intro: Mostuea orientalis, commonly known as the oriental arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Zingiberaceae, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering stems produce clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The rhizomes of Mostuea orientalis are used as a starchy food source and have been historically valued in traditional medicine.
